definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: The fire broke out on the morning of Dec. 23, 1991.
sentences.chinese: 這次火災發生於1991年十二月二十三日的早晨。

sentences.english: Chushu solar terms in each year around August 23.
sentences.chinese: 處暑節氣在每年八月二十三日左右。

sentences.english: Watch June 13th on CBS to see who wins.
sentences.chinese: 請關注六月十三日的CBS看鹿死誰手。

sentences.english: On September 13 we defeated Liu Shih-yi, captured several hundred rifles and took Suichuan.
sentences.chinese: 九月十三日，我軍擊敗劉士毅，繳槍數百，佔領。

sentences.english: On the 13th of July the Pavlograd hussars took part in their first serious action.
sentences.chinese: 七月十三日保羅格勒兵團第一次發生了嚴重的事情。

sentences.english: On the 23rd of October the Russian troops crossed the river Enns.
sentences.chinese: 十月二十三日，俄國軍隊橫渡恩斯河。

sentences.english: The Treaty of Non-Aggression Between the Soviet Union and Germany was signed on August 23, 1939.
sentences.chinese: 蘇德互不侵犯條約訂立於一九三九年八月二十三日。

definition: first month of the lunar year
7-9 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
11 am-1 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
5-7 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
3-5 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
9-11 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
